intro: Adelia cassinoides, commonly known as the slender senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Its leaves are bipinnate, with numerous small leaflets that give it a feathery appearance. Adelia cassinoides is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
